21.str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

21.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

22.str2: All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.

22.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
22.str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

23.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
23.str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of unknown origin; a maiden; by implication, an unmarried daughter.

23.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

23.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: A strengthened form of a primary teko tek'-o; to produce, literally or figuratively.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

23.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
23.str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Of Hebrew origin; God with us; Emmanuel, a name of Christ.

23.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
23.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

24.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Joseph, a proper name. Of Hebrew origin; Joseph, the name of seven Israelites.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
24.str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: (a) I instruct, command, (b) I appoint, assign. From pros and tasso; to arrange towards, i.e. enjoin.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

24.str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular

A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
